events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle on Main Street, requesting to file a claim for damages.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident following the review of the initial report and insurance policy.
An insurance agent was assigned to oversee the claim process and liaise with the customer regarding next steps.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the investigation would begin promptly.
The agent requested submission of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements to support the claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and detailed images of the damaged vehicle parts.
The insurance investigation team began assessing the claim based on the documents and evidence provided.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and the vehicle damage is covered under the policy.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repairs, rental vehicle reimbursement, and related costs.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and thanked the team for their prompt handling.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the settlement proposal without any objections.
Payment for the approved claim was issued via bank transfer to the customerâ€™s account for vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that the vehicle repairs were completed and payment received.
